page.title: 10FRECKLETON CLUB DAY
page.content: Freckleton Club Day originated with the Freindly Societies who used to parade through the streets once a year as a public relations excercise.Most soon it developed into carnivals with decorated floats and bands and all the fun of the fair t became the one day in the year when the workers and their families whooped it up.In 1919, after the First World War,to celebrate the retern of peace,the churchs organised processions of witness followed by children's sports on the green but people still thought of it as a "Club Day" and the name stuck.The church processions are much the same today,an act of witness when,menbers of the Methodist Chapel,Roman Catholic Church and the Church of England walk in the morning.
